Horton: meaningful discussions abt gender politics have also been tricky. We must increase our efforts in this regard. #womenANDhealth
Horton: But we're becoming LESS accountable to women. The democratic process can support more independent accountability. #womenANDhealth
Horton: We’re seeing great demand for universal health coverage and we need to ride that wave #womenANDhealth
Horton: Regarding the recommendations, we are seeing great progress related to some areas; I’m worried about others. #womenAND health
Now closing with final thoughts from @richardhorton1 #womenANDhealth
.@joylawn: We need to recognize the roots of global public health (wise, white men) & create more opportunities for wise women of the world.
Langer: We need more proactive effort to balance the scales in academia as well among leaders and faculty #womenANDhealth
Horton: Thanks to @IlonaKickbusch and her efforts to highlight women leaders in global health #wgh100 #womenANDhealth
Knaul: New metrics are needed that better represent our full view on health; GDP is important as it’s the best we have now #womenANDhealth
Q: How can we support more women in leadership roles within health? #womenANDhealth
Frances Day-Stirk, @world_midwives: TY for highlighting the health needs of the poorest women. We need to value women more. #womenANDhealth
Q: What about disabilities? What do we need to do to look at women’s health issues for the disabled. #womenANDhealth
Q: What more do we need to do about metrics? GDP doesn’t seem to capture everything we value in society. #womenANDhealth
Continuing our Q&A: Langer: We need to adjust our policies so that they don't perpetuate gender stereotypes #womenANDhealth
AGREE! RT @UNDP: Invest in women & girls to invest in #globalprogress! #Action2015 http://t.co/9h9e3wRTbO https://t.co/t2gYWeGoEF
Frenk: We need good data to trigger political response #womenANDhealth
RT @TheLancet: "We need diversity with equality: it's a political process" @julio_frenk http://t.co/cEtsapS79G #womenANDhealth http://t.co/…
Frenk: The only cultural construct that is constant across time and space is men trying to suppress women. How do we fix this?
A: We need to value diversity with equality within the health workforce and global public health, correcting current imbalances
A: Leveraging the feminization of the health workforce is critical; we need to link with other professions and allied fields #womenANDhealth
Q: How can we get more men involved in these issues and supporting #womenANDhealth?
We're now having a Q+A with the speakers. Tweet any questions to @WHI_Harvard tagging #womenANDhealth http://t.co/ElXZWtqc6s
Campbell: We mustn't forget that action, advocacy, + politics matter, esp related to women's sexual and reproductive health #womenANDhealth
Campbell compares commission to a patchwork quilt, made up of many interconnected pieces w/ some gaps in what we know http://t.co/ldZ1wLUYBy
Campbell underscoring the thought-provoking questions highlighted by the Commission #womenANDhealth http://t.co/RcGwNqgsfa
Campbell: Reciprocity between women and environment, economy, and society are well laid out in the report. #womenANDhelth
Campbell reflecting on women in science and her own training when women were thought of as nuisance in academics and medical schools
Campbell shares thoughts on three things that matter: ideas, policies + services, research + information #womenANDhealth
Now we'll hear from Professor Oona Campbell from @LSHTMpress in response to the commission report #womenANDhealth
Langer: We hope the conversation will continue here today, as well as at future events around the globe #womenANDhealth
Langer: Be Accountable to Women - we need an independent body like the iERG for #womenANDhealth
Langer: Count Women - gender must also be a factor in study design and publications, starting with basic bench science #womenANDhealth
Langer: Count Women - data related to health and the health workforce need to be disaggregated by sex #womenANDhealth
Langer: Compensate Women - create equity with fair pay, especially in the health sector. @UN_Women - we need your help!
Langer: We need policies that do not penalize women for integrating their social, biological, and career contributions #womenANDhealth
Langer: Value women - universal access to health care, recognize paid + unpaid contributions to caregiving, & gender-responsive policies
Langer: Recommendations are grouped into four categories: value, count, compensate, and be accountable to women. #womenANDhealth
Langer to share the recommendations published as part of the commission's report #womenANDhealth
Aran: Impact of such policies on gender equality is still unclear; must keep goal of women's empowerment as end goal #womenANDhealth
Aran: Caregiver allowance policy in Turkey in effect since 2007 to support disabled and elderly #womenANDhealth
Aran: Effective policies are needed to shift the care burden away from women, create incentives and equity #womenANDhealth
